summary: Email correspondence from attorney Martin Weinberg to federal prosecutors regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein and related legal matters. The email chain discusses preservation of evidence from Epstein's detention and death, review of seized electronic media, and coordination with Epstein's estate attorneys.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019 while detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Epstein had a previous incident on July 23, 2019 that was investigated as an attempted suicide.
The FBI initiated an investigation into Epstein's death, and the Attorney General also initiated investigations.
Martin Weinberg, representing Epstein's family, requested preservation of extensive evidence including video footage, staff records, medical reports, and any note found in Epstein's cell.
The correspondence discusses establishing a taint team to review privileged attorney-client communications on seized electronic devices.
